item.title: Rubbish all along the road both sides with no pavement. Carpets, wood dumped, 2nd September
item.description:
The road in between the Heath SE2 where corner shop faces. Disgusting- this was a tidy area but there are imbeciles who don’t care about the area. It’s not the Councils fault it’s the public.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box of gas canisters and glass bottles, 2nd September
item.description:
Box of gas cannisters and glass bottles left disregarded against a tree by side of pavement (side where parked cars are as you enter Ashcroft Ave from Days Lane).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262, Days Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: Deceased Fox, 2nd September
item.description:
There is a deceased fox in the alleyway at the rear of number 81 and 83 Penshurst Avenue Blackfen Can someone please remove the corpse as soon as practicable as it is a health hazard and danger to domestic pets

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very top of Delancey St by the traffic lights at the crossroads with Parkway. It’s beside the little florist’s annex., 2nd September
item.description:
The kerb and pavement are broken forming a small pothole which means that when it rains a large puddle forms which sprays the pedestrians with dirty water. It’s been there for 10 years at least.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Parkway, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The car has been parked here for months and made it difficult for resident to park., 2nd September
item.description:
This car had been parked here for at least 2 months. We went around the neighbourhood and even local garage to see if this car belongs to anybody. Nobody claimed ownership of the car. We strongly believe this is an abandoned vehicle. It is causing community tension as it became increasingly difficult to find parking space for local residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Gardens, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 21 Harvist rd, 2nd September
item.description:
I fell over this obstacle today it needs to be fixed immediately

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harvist Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HUGE dog poo outside Tesco (potentially human), 2nd September
item.description:
Somebody has left a humongous poo right in front of the Southwark Park Road Tesco. As it’s right by the shop, it’s understandably been stepped in by multiple people, and is now trampled all over the pavement. It is absolutely vile. Whoever left this should be found and fined.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 181, Southwark Park Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A resident MRS LEA LANDAU called to advise that some has dumped about 10 bags of paint containers and a few other different items outside of number 7 (by the tree). She complained that this is becoming a usual attitude, 2nd September
item.description:
The resident complained that it is becoming a usual habbit for the residents of the area to illegally dump any kind of waste around that spot.According to the customer, this is anti-social, and dangerous activity that can lead to environmental pollution.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ashtead Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip, 2nd September
item.description:
I first reported this fly tip 3 weeks ago, I really think RBG should have removed it by now. On Donaldson Rd near junction with Shooters Hill, opposite Hill End. Fly tip of old metal ironing board, nitrous oxide cylinder heavy type, 2 pieces of wood & plastic advertising sign for Platinum driveways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Donaldson Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass in cycle lane, 2nd September
item.description:
There is broken glass in the cycle lane, which could pose a real danger. The glass is in the section in front of the new UNCLE development, and the small supermarket there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelyn Street, New Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet
